title: Stepfather uses a leaf blower to push his five-year-old on a rope swing
text:
An ingenious stepfather proved it's better to work smarter not harder when he used a leaf blower to push his five-year-old on a rope swing.

Alex Ramsey was spending time with his stepdaughter Hayden at home in Connecticut, America, earlier this month.

He had been clearing his garden of autumnal leaves that had already started to fall using a leaf blower when Hayden came out to use the rope swing.

The five-year-old then asked her stepfather for a push which is when he decided to use the tools he already had at hand.

In the video, the 24-year-old is stood in a wooded area of the garden with a blue leaf blower in his hand.

Hayden, who is clinging on to the rope swing with both hands, swings round into his path.

Alex Ramsey was spending time with his stepdaughter Hayden at home in Connecticut, America, earlier this month

The five-year-old asked her stepfather for a push on the rope swing which is when he decided to use the tools he already had at hand and lets out bursts of air to keep her spinning round

Alex then lets out a spurt of air from the garden apparatus which sends his stepdaughter further round in a loop.

He repeats this as she swoops round again and she lets out a small screech of excitement as her hair whips up in the breeze.

Alex turns to the camera and chuckles before the family's inquisitive pet dog also appears on screen to get closer to the action.

Eventually, Alex places the leaf blower on to the floor and sets it to be on constantly as the family's inquisitive pet dog comes to investigate the action

Alex turns to the camera and chuckles before muttering 'perfect' and the video ends shortly after

Eventually, he places the leaf blower on to the floor and sets it to be on constantly.

He turns and gestures to the camera as he mutters 'perfect'.

Alex picks the leaf blower up once again, which is where the video ends.
